channel.title: Comments on: Comments for Times Higher Education: University of California break with Elsevier tipped to boost ‘global revolt’

item.title: By: Hemi Hossain
item.dc:creator: Hemi Hossain
item.description: It's really useful blog post. Thanks for sharing.
item.content:encoded: It’s really useful blog post. Thanks for sharing.

item.title: By: protohedgehog
item.dc:creator: protohedgehog
item.description:
In reply to <a href="http://fossilsandshit.com/comments-for-times-higher-education-university-of-california-break-with-elsevier-tipped-to-boost-global-revolt/#comment-3092">Walt Crawford</a>.
I read somewhere before that is about 40% of their total revenue, so the UC alone would be 4% of the total global revenue. I can hunt down the statistics if needed, but probably just from Elsevier's annual reports.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Walt Crawford.

I read somewhere before that is about 40% of their total revenue, so the UC alone would be 4% of the total global revenue. I can hunt down the statistics if needed, but probably just from Elsevier’s annual reports.

item.title: By: Walt Crawford
item.dc:creator: Walt Crawford
item.description: I do wonder about this: "So for the US this is a big deal, but on a global scale still just another drop in the ocean." Dunno what percentage of the world''s scholarly output comes from the US, but seems to me UC's scholarship might be a significant chink.
item.content:encoded: I do wonder about this: “So for the US this is a big deal, but on a global scale still just another drop in the ocean.” Dunno what percentage of the world”s scholarly output comes from the US, but seems to me UC’s scholarship might be a significant chink.
